describe: Zimbabwe is a landlocked country located in Southern Africa, known for its diverse wildlife, dramatic landscapes, and rich cultural heritage. It is home to the famous Victoria Falls, one of the largest and most spectacular waterfalls in the world.

cities.name: üèô Harare
cities.geographical_location: Located in the northeastern part of Zimbabwe, Harare is the capital and largest city.
cities.climate: Harare has a subtropical highland climate, with mild temperatures and a rainy season from November to March.
cities.famous_cuisine: Sadza, a staple dish made from cornmeal, often served with meat or vegetables.

cities.name: üèô Bulawayo
cities.geographical_location: Situated in the southwestern part of Zimbabwe, Bulawayo is the second-largest city.
cities.climate: Bulawayo has a semi-arid climate, with hot summers and mild winters.
cities.famous_cuisine: Mapopo candy, a sweet treat made from papaya.

cities.geographical_location: Located on the western border of Zimbabwe, adjacent to the Zambezi River.
cities.climate: Victoria Falls has a tropical climate, with a distinct wet and dry season.
cities.famous_cuisine: Bream fish, often grilled or fried, served with local sides.
